name: Thallium(I) bromide
desc: Thallium(I) bromide is a chemical compound of thallium and bromine with a chemical formula TlBr. It is used in room-temperature detectors of X-rays, gamma-rays and blue light, as well as in near-infrared optics.
EU classification (DSD) (outdated):
Very toxic (T+)
Dangerous for the environment (N)
Other anions:
Thallium(I) fluoride,
Thallium(I) chloride,
Thallium(I) iodide
Other cations:
Indium(I) bromide,
Lead(II) bromide
Bismuth bromide
